summary.long: Numbers is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: In the Sinai desert, the Lord spoke to Moses inside the Tent of Meeting on the first day of the second month of the second year after they had left the land of Egypt. He said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Take a census of the entire Israeli community, numbering them by their tribes and by ancestral houses. List the names of every male one-by-one,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from 20 years and upward. You and Aaron are to register everyone in Israel who is able to go to war, company by company.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One man from each tribe is to accompany you, each man being the leader of his ancestral house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Here is a list of names of the men who are to assist you:
“From Reuben: Shedeur’s son Elizur.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Simeon: Zurishaddai’s son Shelumiel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Judah: Amminadab’s son Nahshon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Issachar: Zuar’s son Nethanel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Zebulun: Helon’s son Eliab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “From Joseph’s descendants through Ephraim: Ammihud’s son Elishama. From Manasseh: Pedahzur’s son Gamaliel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Benjamin: Gideoni’s son Abidan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Dan: Ammishaddai’s son Ahiezer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Asher: Ochran’s son Pagiel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Gad: Deuel’s son Eliasaph.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Naphtali: Enan’s son Ahira.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These men were appointed from within their communities, since they were leaders of their ancestral houses and heads of the tribes of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses and Aaron gathered these men who had been mentioned by name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They assembled the entire community together during the second month. Then they recorded their ancestries, according to their tribes and ancestral houses, as well as the names of the men 20 years old and above individually,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: just as the Lord had commanded Moses. He numbered them in the Sinai desert.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The genealogies of the descendants of Reuben, the firstborn of Israel, were recorded individually, according to their tribes and ancestral houses, as were the names of all the men 20 years and above who could serve in the army.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those registered with the tribe of Reuben numbered 46,500.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The genealogies of Simeon’s descendants were recorded individually, according to their tribes and ancestral houses, as were the names of all the men 20 years and above who could serve in the army.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those registered with the tribe of Simeon numbered 59,300.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The genealogies of Gad’s descendants were recorded individually, according to their tribes and ancestral houses, as were the names of all the men 20 years and above who could serve in the army.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those registered with the tribe of Gad numbered 45,650.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The genealogies of Judah’s descendants were recorded individually, according to their tribes and ancestral houses, as were the names of all the men 20 years and above who could serve in the army.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those registered with the tribe of Judah numbered 74,600.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The genealogies of Issachar’s descendants were recorded individually, according to their tribes and ancestral houses, as were the names of all the men 20 years and above who could serve in the army.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those registered with the tribe of Issachar numbered 54,400.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The genealogies of Zebulun’s descendants were recorded individually, according to their tribes and ancestral houses, as were the names of all the men 20 years and above who could serve in the army.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those registered with the tribe of Zebulun numbered 57,400.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The genealogies of Joseph’s descendants were recorded individually, according to their tribes and ancestral houses, as were the names of all the men 20 years and above who could serve in the army.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those registered with the tribe of Joseph numbered 40,500.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The genealogies of Manasseh’s descendants were recorded individually, according to their tribes and ancestral houses, as were the names of all the men 20 years and above who could serve in the army.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those registered with the tribe of Manasseh numbered 32,200.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The genealogies of Benjamin’s descendants were recorded individually, according to their tribes and ancestral houses, as were the names of all the men 20 years and above who could serve in the army.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those registered with the tribe of Benjamin numbered 35,400.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The genealogies of Dan’s descendants were recorded individually, according to their tribes and ancestral houses, as were the names of all the men 20 years and above who could serve in the army.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those registered with the tribe of Dan numbered 62,700.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The genealogies of Asher’s descendants were recorded individually, according to their tribes and ancestral houses, as were the names of all the men 20 years and above who could serve in the army.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those registered with the tribe of Asher numbered 41,500.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The genealogies of Naphtali’s descendants were recorded individually, according to their tribes and ancestral houses, as were the names of all the men 20 years and above who could serve in the army.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those registered with the family of Naphtali numbered 53,400.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These individuals were the ones whom Moses and Aaron registered from the twelve leaders of Israel, each person from his ancestral house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everyone was numbered from the descendants of Israel, from their ancestral houses, from all the men who were 20 years and above and who could serve in the army.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The total of all those who were numbered was 603,550.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The descendants of Levi were not counted according to their ancestral houses
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because the Lord had ordered Moses:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Be sure not to number or count the tribe of Levi with the rest of the Israelis.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Instead, appoint the descendants of Levi over the Tent of Meeting, all the vessels, and everything in it. They are to carry the tent and all the vessels in it. They are to attend to it and camp around it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whenever the tent is ready for travel, the descendants of Levi are to take it down. When it’s time to encamp, the descendants of Levi are to set it up. Any unauthorized person who approaches it is to be executed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Israelis are to encamp around the tent, arranged according to their company and the standard of their army.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the descendants of Levi are to encamp on all sides of the Tent of Meeting so that divine wrath won’t fall on the congregation of Israel. The descendants of Levi are to take care of the Tent of Meeting.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Israelis observed everything that the Lord had commanded Moses, doing exactly what they were told.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Later, the Lord told Moses and Aaron,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Every single Israeli is to encamp beneath his standard with the emblem of his ancestral house. The Israelis are to encamp in front of and surrounding the Tent of Meeting.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The encampment of Judah is to settle east toward the sunrise under their standard. The leader of Judah is to be Amminadab’s son Nahshon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those in his division number 74,600.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The tribe of Issachar is to encamp beside Judah. The leader of Issachar is to be Zuar’s son Nethanel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those in his division number 54,400.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Next is to be the tribe of Zebulun. The leader of Zebulun is to be Helon’s son Eliab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those in his division number 57,400.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All those numbered by division in the camp of Judah total 186,400. They are to be the first to travel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Toward the south is to be the division of the camp of Reuben under their standard. The leader of Reuben is to be Shedeur’s son Elizur.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those in his division number 46,500.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The tribe of Simeon is to camp beside Reuben. The leader of Simeon is to be Zurishaddai’s son Shelumiel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those in his division number 59,300.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Next is to be the tribe of Gad. The leader of Gad is to be Deuel’s son Eliasaph.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those in his division number 45,650.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All those numbered by division in the camp of Reuben total 151,450. They are to be the second to travel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then the Tent of Meeting is to travel with the camp of the descendants of Levi in the middle of the camps. They are to travel just as they have camped, each as designated under his standard.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Toward the west is to be the division of the camp of Ephraim under their standard. The leader of Ephraim is to be Ammihud’s son Elishama.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those in his division number 40,500.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The tribe of Manasseh is to encamp beside them. The leader of Manasseh is to be Pedahzur’s son Gamaliel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those in his division number 32,200.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Next is to be the tribe of Benjamin. The leader of Benjamin is to be Gideoni’s son Abidan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those in his division number 35,400.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All those numbered by division in the camp Ephraim total 108,100. They are to be the third to travel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Toward the north is to be the division of the camp of Dan under their standard. The leader of Dan is to be Ammishaddai’s son Ahiezer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those in his division number 62,700.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The tribe of Asher is to encamp beside them. The leader of Asher is to be Ochran’s son Pagiel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those in his division number 41,500.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Next is to be the tribe of Naphtali. The leader of Naphtali is to be Enan’s son Ahira.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those in his division number 53,400.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All those numbered by division in the camp of Dan total 157,600. They are to be the last to travel under their standards.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Here is a summary of the census of the Israelis according to the tribes of their ancestral houses: All the divisions in the camps numbered 603,550,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but the descendants of Levi were not numbered along with the other Israelis, just as the Lord had commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Israelis did everything just as the Lord had commanded Moses; that is, they encamped under their standard as each person traveled with his own tribe and ancestral house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is a record of the genealogies of Aaron and Moses current as of the day on which the Lord addressed Moses on Mount Sinai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Aaron were Nadab the first-born, Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who were anointed priests and whom he consecrated as priests.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nadab and Abihu died in the Lord’s presence when they offered unauthorized fire before him in the Sinai wilderness. Since they didn’t have their own children, Eleazar and Ithamar ministered as priests under the authority of Aaron their father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord told Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Bring the tribe of Levi near and present them to Aaron the priest so they may serve him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are to take care of his needs and the needs of the whole congregation at the Tent of Meeting by performing duties at the tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are to take charge of the utensils at the Tent of Meeting and meet the needs of the Israelis by performing duties on behalf of the tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Assign the descendants of Levi to Aaron and his sons from among the Israelis.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Appoint Aaron and his sons so that they are to take responsibility for their priesthood. Any unauthorized person who approaches it is to be put to death.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Later, the Lord told Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I’m taking the descendants of Levi for myself from among the Israelis in place of every first-born who opens the womb. The descendants of Levi belong to me
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because all the first-born belong to me. When I destroyed all the firstborn in the land of Egypt, I consecrated all the first-born in Israel for myself—from human beings to livestock. They belong to me, since I am the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord also told Moses in the Sinai wilderness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Number the descendants of Levi according to their ancestral houses and tribes, numbering every male from a month old and above.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses numbered them according to the instruction of the Lord, as he had been commanded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are Levi’s descendants by name: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are names of Gershon’s descendants according to their families: Libni and Shimei.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the names of Kohath’s descendants according to their families: Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Merari’s descendants according to their families were Mahli and Mushi. These are the families of the descendants of Levi according to their ancestral house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The families of Libni and Shimei were descendants of Gershon. As families of the descendants of Gershon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: all the males a month old and above numbered 7,500.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The families of the descendants of Gershon encamped behind the tent toward the west.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The leader of the tribe and family of Gershon was Lael’s son Eliasaph.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The duties of the descendants of Gershon at the Tent of Meeting pertained to the tent, the tent covering, the curtain to the entrance to the Tent of Meeting,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the hangings at the courtyard, the curtain at the entrance of the courtyard that surrounded the tent, the altar, and all of the tent cords in use.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The families of Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel were descendants of Kohath. As families of the descendants of Kohath,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: all the males a month old and above numbered 8,600. They were tasked to the care of the sanctuary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The descendants of Kohath encamped beside the tent toward the south.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The leader of the tribe and family of Kohath was Uzziel’s son Elizaphan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their duties pertained to the ark, the table, the lamp stand, the altars, the utensils of the sanctuary with which they ministered, and all the curtains in use.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The chief of all the leaders of the descendants of Levi was Aaron the priest’s son Eleazar. He was assigned to oversee those who were in charge of the services of the sanctuary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The families of Mahli and Mushi were descendants of Merari. As families of Merari,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: all the males a month old and above numbered 6,200.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The leader of the tribe and family of Merari was Abihail’s son Zuriel. The descendants of Merari encamped beside the tent toward the north.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The duties of the caretakers from the descendants of Merari included the boards of the tent, its bars, crossbars, sockets, all its utensils for their services,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the pillars around the courtyard, their sockets, pegs, and tent cords.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In front of the tent and east of the Tent of Meeting, Moses, Aaron, and Aaron’s sons encamped facing the east. They were tasked to perform the duties of the sanctuary and care for the needs of the Israelis. Any unauthorized person who approached was to be executed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As the Lord had instructed, everyone counted by Moses and Aaron from the descendants of Levi, according to their tribe, all males from a month old and above numbered 22,000.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Later the Lord instructed Moses: “Number all the first-born males of Israel from a month old and above and list their names.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Separate the descendants of Levi for me—since I am the Lord—in place of all the first-born sons of Israel. Also separate the livestock of the descendants of Levi in place of all the firstborn of the livestock of Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses numbered all the firstborn from the sons of Israel just as the Lord commanded him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the first-born males according to the list of their names from a month old and above numbered 22,273.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord told Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Separate the descendants of Levi in place of all the firstborn sons of Israel and the livestock of the descendants of Levi in place of their livestock. The descendants of Levi belong to me, since I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to pay a ransom for the 273 first-born Israelis who exceed the census number of the descendants of Levi,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so collect five shekels for each individual, denominated in shekels of the sanctuary, that is, the shekel that weighs 20 gerahs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then give the money meant for ransom of their excess to Aaron and his sons.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses took the ransom money to account for the difference in the total number of those redeemed by the descendants of Levi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the firstborn of the Israelis, Moses took money amounting to 1,365 shekels according to the shekel of the sanctuary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses gave the ransom money to Aaron and his sons according to the Lord’s instructions, just as the Lord had commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord told Moses and Aaron,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Take a census of the descendants of Kohath from among the descendants of Levi according to their tribes and ancestral houses
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from 30 years and older through the age of 50 years, from everyone who can enter the service to perform work at the Tent of Meeting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Here’s what the descendants of Kohath are to do regarding the Tent of Meeting and what’s inside the Most Holy Place:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the camp is about to travel, Aaron and his sons are to come and take down the veil of the curtain and cover the Ark of the Testimony with it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are to set a leather-dyed skin covering over it, cover it with a pure blue cloth, and then insert its poles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “They are to spread a blue cloth over the table of the Presence and on top of it the dishes, pans, bowls, pitchers for drink offerings, and the bread of presence are to be on it continually.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are to spread over them a scarlet cloth and a leather-dyed skin covering and then insert its poles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “They are to take a blue cloth and cover the lamp stand for the light with its lamp, lamp-snuffers, censer, and all the utensils for its oil with which they minister.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they are to put them with all the other utensils on the leather-dyed skin covering and set them on the beams for transport.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “On the golden altar, they are to spread a blue cloth, cover it with a leather-dyed skin covering, and then insert its poles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they are to take all the utensils for service with which they minister at the sanctuary, set them on the blue cloth, cover them with the leather-dyed skin covering, and then set them on the beams for transport.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are also to remove the ashes on the altar and spread a purple cloth over it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they are to put all the instruments with which they minister there—trays, forks, shovels, bowls, and all the utensils of the altar. They are to spread over it a leather-dyed skin covering and then insert its poles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When Aaron and his sons have finished covering the sanctuary and all the utensils of the sanctuary, and the camp is about to travel, then the descendants of Kohath are to come and carry them, but they are not to touch the most sacred objects, so they won’t die. These are the duties of the descendants of Kohath at the Tent of Meeting.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now the duty of Eleazar, the son of Aaron the priest is to maintain the oil for the light, the spiced incense, the daily offerings, andthe oil for anointing, to carry out all the duties of the tent and the sanctuary, and to maintain its utensils.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord told Moses and Aaron,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are not to eliminate the tribe of the families of the descendants of Kohath from the descendants of Levi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But do this for them so that they may live and not die when they approach the Most Holy Place: Aaron and his sons are to go in and set specific responsibilities for each of them to carry out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they are not to go in to see the sanctuary as it is being covered, so they won’t die.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord told Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Take a census of the descendants of Gershon according to their ancestral house and tribes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Count their number from between 30 to 50 years old, including everyone who can enter the service to perform work at the Tent of Meeting.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “These are the responsibilities that the descendants of Gershon are to have:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are to carry the curtain of the tent, the covering of the Tent of Meeting, the dyed leather covering that goes over it, the curtain for the entrance to the Tent of Meeting,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the hangings for the courtyard, the curtain for the entrance to the gate of the courtyard that surrounds the tent, the altar, the ropes, all the service utensils, and everything made for them. This is to be their service area.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The descendants of Gershon are to carry out the instructions of Aaron and his sons. You are to assign them their responsibilities to carry out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the work of the tribes of Gershon at the Tent of Meeting—their duties under the supervision of Ithamar, the son of Aaron the priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For the descendants of Merari, number them according to their tribes and ancestral houses
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from 30 to 50 years old as you count them, including everyone who can enter service and perform work at the Tent of Meeting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is to be their area of responsibility to carry out with respect to their service at the Tent of Meeting: the board of the tent, its bars, its crossbars, its sockets,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the pillars around the courtyard, their sockets, their pegs, their ropes, and all the utensils for all their services. Assign the utensils by name to each person whose responsibility it will be to carry them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the work of the tribes of the descendants of Merari with reference to their service at the Tent of Meeting under the supervision of Aaron the priest’s son Ithamar.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses, Aaron, and the congregational leaders numbered the descendants of Kohath according to their tribes and ancestral houses
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from 30 to 50 years old—that is, everyone who entered the service to perform work at the Tent of Meeting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The total according to their tribe numbered 2,750
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from the tribe of the descendants of Kohath, everyone who would be serving at the Tent of Meeting, whom Moses and Aaron numbered according to what the Lord had said, under the supervision of Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The tribes and the ancestral houses of the descendants of Gershon were numbered
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from 30 to 50 years old; that is, everyone who entered the service to perform work at the Tent of Meeting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The total according to their tribes and ancestral house numbered 2,630
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from the tribes of the descendants of Gershon, everyone who would be serving at the Tent of Meeting, whom Moses and Aaron numbered according to what the Lord had said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The tribes and ancestral house of Merari were numbered
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from 30 to 50 years old; that is, everyone who entered the service to perform work at the Tent of Meeting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The total according to their tribes numbered 3,200
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from the tribes of the descendants of Merari, whom Moses and Aaron numbered according to what the Lord had said, under the supervision of Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The total of those who were numbered from the descendants of Levi by Moses and Aaron; that is, from the leaders of Israel counted according to their tribes and ancestral houses
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from 30 to 50 years old, who entered the service for work at the Tent of Meeting
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were numbered under the supervision of Moses according to what the Lord had said. Each person was assigned a responsibility to carry out, just as the Lord had commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord told Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Command the Israelis to send outside the encampment every leper, everyone who has a discharge, and whoever is ritually defiled by contact with a corpse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whether male or female, send them outside the camp so that they won’t defile their camp, because I live among them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Israelis sent them outside the camp. The Israelis did just what the Lord had told Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord told Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Instruct the Israelis that whenever a man or woman does something contained in the list of the sins of man, thereby acting treacherously against the Lord, then that person stands guilty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is to confess the sin that he had committed, pay its full compensation, add one fifth to it, and give the compensation to whomever he offended.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if the person has no related redeemer to whom compensation may be made, the payment is to be brought to the Lord and given to the priest, in addition to a ram for atonement with which he is to be atoned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every offering from all the most sacred things of the Israelis that they bring to the priest is to belong to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Furthermore, everyone’s sacred things belong to him, as well as whatever a person gives to the priest.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord told Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Instruct the Israelis what to do if a man’s wife turns astray so that she unfaithfully acts against him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a man has sexual relations with her and she conceals it from her husband, keeping it secret although she has defiled herself with there being no witnesses against her, but she was caught anyway.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If an attitude of jealousy overcomes him so that he becomes jealous at his wife when she is defiled, or if an attitude of jealousy overcomes him and he becomes jealous of his wife even though she isn’t defiled,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then that man is to bring his wife to the priest along with an offering for her consisting of a tenth of an ephah of barley flour. He is not to pour oil or set frankincense over it, because it’s to be a jealousy offering, a memorial offering that will serve as a reminder of iniquity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the priest is to bring it and make her stand in the Lord’s presence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priest is to put some holy water into an earthen vessel, take some dust from the floor of the tent, and put it into the water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priest is to have the woman stand in the Lord’s presence, uncover her head, and put the grain offering as a memorial, a reminder of jealousy, into her hands. The priest is also to have in his hand the contaminated water that carries a curse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The priest is to administer this oath to the woman: ‘If indeed another man didn’t have sexual relations with you and you didn’t become unfaithful to your husband, then may you be free from these waters that bring a curse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you have become unfaithful to your husband and have become defiled because a man who isn’t your husband has had sexual relations with you…’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then the priest is to have the woman commit to an oath by saying to the woman, ‘May the Lord make you a curse and a curse among your people. When the Lord makes your thigh waste away and your abdomen swell
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and this water that brings a curse enters your abdomen, making it swell and your thigh waste away.’
“Then the woman is to say ‘Amen.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then the priest is to write all of these words in a document and wipe it off with the contaminated water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The woman is to drink the bitter water that brings a curse and the water that brings a curse is to be considered contaminated.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priest is to take the offering of jealousy from the woman’s hand, wave the offering in the Lord’s presence, and have her approach the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priest is to take a handful of grain from the memorial and offer a sacrifice on the altar, after which he is to have the woman drink the water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he has had her drink the water, if she was defiled and had acted unfaithfully toward her husband, then the contaminated water that brings a curse will enter her and infect her, causing her abdomen to swell and her thigh to waste away. Then she is to be a cursed woman among her people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if the woman isn’t defiled, then she is to be freed and will be able to bear children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the law in cases of jealousy when a woman defiles herself while under her husband’s authority:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When a man becomes under the control of an attitude of jealousy regarding his wife, he is to present her to the Lord, and the priest is to apply this entire statute to her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The husband will be free from guilt, but the wife is to bear the punishment of her iniquity.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord told Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Tell the Israelis that a man or woman who commits to the vow of the Nazirite, is to be separated to the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then is to remain separate from wine and strong drink. He is not to drink vinegar or strong drink made from wine. He is not to drink grape juice or eat grapes, whether fresh or dried.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: During the entire time of his dedication, he is not to eat any product from the grapevine, from the seed to the skin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: During the entire time of his dedication, he is not to allow a razor to pass over his head until the days of his holy consecration to the Lord have been fulfilled. He is to let the locks on his head grow long.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “During the entire time of his dedication, he is not to come near a dead body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is not to defile himself on account of his father, mother, brother, and sister when they die, because the crown of his consecration to God is on his head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: During the entire time of his dedication, he is set apart to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When someone suddenly dies beside him, so that his consecrated head is defiled, then he is to shave his head on the day of his purification. Seven days later he is to shave it again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the eighth day, he is to bring two turtledoves or two pigeons to the priest at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the priest is to offer one for a sin offering and the other for a burnt offering to make atonement for him because of the guilt he incurred on account of his contact with the dead body. Then he is to consecrate his head on that day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is to dedicate to the Lord the days of his consecration by bringing a year old male lamb as his offering. The previous time will have failed because his consecration became defiled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This is the law of the Nazirite: When the days of his consecration are completed, he is to come to the entrance at the Tent of Meeting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is to bring an offering to the Lord, a year old male lamb, and a year old ewe female lamb, both without blemish, for a sin offering and a ram without blemish for a peace offering,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a basket of unleavened bread made from choice flour, cakes mixed with oil, a wafer of unleavened bread smeared with oil, along with grain and drink offerings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priest is to come into the Lord’s presence and present his sin and burnt offerings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is to offer the ram, a sacrifice of peace offering to the Lord, along with the basket of unleavened bread. Then the priest is to present his grain and drink offerings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Nazirite is then to shave his head of consecration at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting. He is to take the lock of his head of consecration and set it over the fire where the peace offering for sacrifice is.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the priest is to take the boiled shoulder of the ram, one cake of unleavened bread from the basket, and one wafer of unleavened bread. He is to place them in the hands of the Nazirite, after he himself has shaved his symbol of consecration.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priest is to wave the offerings, that is, the breast and the thigh offering in the Lord’s presence. Then the Nazirite may drink wine afterward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is to be the law of the Nazirite when he commits his offering to the Lord on account of his consecration, over and beyond what he owns alone plus whatever he can provide, based on the vow from his own mouth that he vows to fulfill on account of the law of his consecration.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Later, the Lord told Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Teach Aaron and his sons to bless the Israelis:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May the Lord bless you
    and guard you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May the Lord’s face enlighten you
    and bestow favor on you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May the Lord turn to face you,
    lavishing peace on you!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are to pour out my name to the Israelis while I continue to bless them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The same day that Moses finished setting up, anointing, and consecrating the tent and its utensils, he also anointed and consecrated the altar and its utensils.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the presiding leaders of Israel, as heads of the ancestral houses, brought an offering. They were the leaders of the tribes who supervised the census.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They brought their offering into the Lord’s presence, consisting of six covered carts and twelve oxen—one cart each from two leaders and an ox from each one. After they presented them in front of the tent,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the Lord told Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Take these gifts from them and use them in service at the Tent of Meeting. Present them to the descendants of Levi, distributing them to each person according to his work.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses took the carts and the oxen and presented them to the descendants of Levi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Two carts and four oxen were given to the descendants of Gershon for their work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Four carts and eight oxen were given to the descendants of Merari for their work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he gave none of them to the descendants of Kohath, because their responsibility was to carry the holy things on their shoulders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The leaders brought the offerings for the dedication of the altar the same day that it was anointed. After the leaders brought their offering to the altar,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the Lord told Moses, “They are to present their offerings, one leader per day, for the dedication of the altar.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the first day Amminadab’s son Nahshon, from the tribe of Judah, presented
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as his offering a silver dish weighing 130 shekels and a silver bowl weighing 70 shekels (calculated according to the shekel of the sanctuary), both filled with choice flour mixed with oil for a grain offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one gold pan weighing ten shekels, full of incense;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one young bull, one ram, and a one year old male lamb for a burnt offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and one male goat for a sin offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their sacrifice for a peace offering consisted of two bulls, five rams, five male goats, and five one year old lambs. These were the offerings presented by Amminadab’s son Nahshon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the second day, Zuar’s son Nethanel, leader of the descendants of Issachar, presented
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as his offering a silver dish weighing 130 shekels and a silver bowl weighing 70 shekels (calculated according to the shekel of the sanctuary), both filled with choice flour mixed with oil for a grain offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one gold pan weighing ten shekels, full of incense;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one young bull, one ram, and a one year old male lamb for a burnt offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and one male goat for a sin offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their sacrifice for a peace offering consisted of two bulls, five rams, five male goats, and five one year old lambs. These were the offerings presented by Zuar’s son Nathaniel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the third day, Helon’s son Eliab, leader of the descendants of Zebulun presented
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as his offering a silver dish weighing 130 shekels and a silver bowl weighing 70 shekels (calculated according to the shekel of the sanctuary), both filled with choice flour mixed with oil for a grain offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one gold pan weighing ten shekels, full of incense;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one young bull, one ram, and a one year old male lamb for a burnt offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and one male goat for a sin offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their sacrifice for a peace offering consisted of two bulls, five rams, five male goats, and five one year old lambs. These were the offerings presented by Helon’s son Eliab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the fourth day, Shedeur’s son Elizur, leader of the descendants of Reuben presented
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as his offering a silver dish weighing 130 shekels and a silver bowl weighing 70 shekels (calculated according to the shekel of the sanctuary), both filled with choice flour mixed with oil for a grain offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one gold pan weighing ten shekels, full of incense;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one young bull, one ram, and a one year old male lamb for a burnt offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and one male goat for a sin offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their sacrifice for a peace offering, two bulls, five rams, five male goats, and five one year old lambs. These were the offerings presented by Shedeur’s son Elizur.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the fifth day, Zurishaddai’s son Shelumiel, leader of the descendants of Simeon, presented
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as his offering a silver dish weighing 130 shekels and a silver bowl weighing 70 shekels (calculated according to the shekel of the sanctuary), both filled with choice flour mixed with oil for grain offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one gold pan weighing ten shekels, full of incense;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one young bull, one ram, and a one year old male lamb for a burnt offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and one male goat for a sin offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their sacrifice for a peace offering consisted of two bulls, five rams, five male goats, and five one year old lambs. These were the offerings presented by Zurishaddai’s son Shelumiel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the sixth day, Deuel’s son Eliasaph, leader of the descendants of Gad, presented
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as his offering a silver dish weighing 130 shekels and a silver bowl weighing 70 shekels (calculated according to the shekel of the sanctuary), both filled with choice flour mixed with oil for a grain offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one gold pan weighing ten shekels full of incense;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one young bull, one ram, and a one year old male lamb for a burnt offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and one male goat for a sin offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their sacrifice for a peace offering consisted of two bulls, five rams, five male goats, and five one year old lambs. These were the offerings presented by Deuel’s son Eliasaph.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the seventh day, Ammihud’s son Elishama, leader of the descendants of Ephraim, presented
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as his offering a silver dish weighing 130 shekels and a silver bowl weighing 70 shekels (calculated according to the shekel of the sanctuary), both filled with choice flour mixed with oil for a grain offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one gold pan weighing ten shekels, full of incense;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one young bull, one ram, and a one year old male lamb for a burnt offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and one male goat for a sin offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their sacrifice for a peace offering consisted of two bulls, five rams, five male goats, and five one year old lambs. These were the offerings presented by Ammihud’s son Elishama.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the eighth day, Pedahzur’s son Gamaliel, leader of the descendants of Manasseh, presented
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as his offering a silver dish weighing 130 shekels and a silver bowl weighing 70 shekels (calculated according to the shekel of the sanctuary), both filled with choice flour mixed with oil for grain offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one gold pan weighing ten shekels full of incense;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one young bull, one ram, and a one year old male lamb for a burnt offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and one male goat for a sin offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their sacrifice for a peace offering consisted of two bulls, five rams, five male goats, and five one year old lambs. These were the offerings presented by Pedahzur’s son Gamaliel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the ninth day, Gideoni’s son Abidan, leader of the descendants of Benjamin, presented
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as his offering a silver dish weighing 130 shekels and a silver bowl weighing 70 shekels (calculated according to the shekel of the sanctuary), both filled with choice flour mixed with oil for grain offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one gold pan weighing ten shekels, full of incense;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one young bull, one ram, and a one year old male lamb for a burnt offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and one male goat for a sin offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their sacrifice for a peace offering consisted of two bulls, five rams, five male goats, and five one year old lambs. These were the offerings presented by Gideoni’s son Abidan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the tenth day, Ammishaddai’s son Ahiezer, leader of the descendants of Dan, presented
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as his offering a silver dish weighing 130 shekels and a silver bowl weighing 70 shekels (calculated according to the shekel of the sanctuary), both filled with choice flour mixed with oil for a grain offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one gold pan weighing ten shekels full of incense;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one young bull, one ram, and a one year old male lamb for a burnt offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and one male goat for a sin offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their sacrifice for a peace offering consisted of two bulls, five rams, five male goats, and five one year old lambs. These were the offerings presented by Ammishaddai’s son Ahiezer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the eleventh day, Ochran’s son Pagiel, leader of the descendants of Asher, presented
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as his offering a silver dish weighing 130 shekels and a silver bowl weighing 70 shekels (calculated according to the shekel of the sanctuary), both filled with choice flour mixed with oil for a grain offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one gold pan weighing ten shekels, full of incense;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one young bull, one ram, and a one year old male lamb for a burnt offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and one male goat for a sin offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their sacrifice for a peace offering consisted of two bulls, five rams, five male goats, and five one year old lambs. These were the offerings presented by Ochran’s son Pagiel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the twelfth day, Enan’s son Ahira, leader of the descendants of Naphtali, presented
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as his offering a silver dish weighing 130 shekels and a silver bowl weighing 70 shekels (calculated according to the shekel of the sanctuary), both filled with choice flour mixed with oil for grain offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one gold pan weighing ten shekels, full of incense;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one young bull, one ram, and a one year old male lamb for a burnt offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and one male goat for a sin offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their sacrifice for a peace offering consisted of two bulls, five rams, five male goats, and five one year old lambs. These were the offerings presented by Enan’s son Ahira.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This was what was presented at the dedication of the altar from the leaders of Israel on the same day that it was anointed: twelve silver bowls, twelve silver basins, twelve gold ladles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Each bowl weighed 130 silver shekels and each basin weighed 70 shekels. All the silver vessels weighed a total of 2,400 shekels, calculated according to the shekel of the sanctuary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also, twelve gold ladles filled with incense were presented, each ladle weighing ten shekels (calculated according to the shekel of the sanctuary). All of the gold of the ladles weighed 120 shekels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the livestock for burnt offerings totaled twelve bulls, twelve rams, twelve sheep in their first year with corresponding meal offerings, and twelve male goats for sin offerings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the livestock for peace offerings totaled 24 bulls, 60 rams, 60 male goats, and 60 one year old lambs—all this was for the altar’s dedication after it was anointed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Moses entered the Tent of Meeting to speak with the Lord, he heard a voice speaking to him above the Mercy Seat over the Ark of the Testimony. He spoke to him from between the two cherubim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord told Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Tell Aaron, ‘When you set up the lamps, the seven lamps will illuminate the area in front of the lamp stand.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Aaron did so, setting up the lamps to illuminate the area in front of the lamp stand, just as the Lord had commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This was how the lamp stand was crafted from hammered gold: From its base to its flowers, it was made of hammered gold. Moses crafted the lamp stand just as the Lord had showed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord told Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Take the descendants of Levi from the Israelis and purify them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what you are to do for them in order to purify them: Sprinkle purifying water over them, have them shave their skin, and then have them wash their garments, and they will be purified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are to take a young bull along with its meal offering made of flour mixed with oil. Then you are to take a second young bull as a sin offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Assemble the descendants of Levi in front of the appointed place of meeting, and assemble the whole congregation of Israel, too.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bring the descendants of Levi into the Lord’s presence and have the Israelis lay their hands on the descendants of Levi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then Aaron is to present the descendants of Levi as a wave offering before the Lord from the Israelis, because they are to work in the service of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The descendants of Levi are then to lay their hands on the head of the bulls, offering one for a sin offering and the other one for a burnt offering to the Lord to atone for the descendants of Levi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to make the descendants of Levi stand in the presence of Aaron and his sons. Then you are to wave them as wave offerings to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is how you are to separate the descendants of Levi from among the Israelis. The descendants of Levi belong to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “After this, the descendants of Levi are to come to serve at the appointed place of meeting, after you have purified them and presented them as wave offerings,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: since they’ve been set apart for me from among the Israelis. I’ve taken them for myself instead of the first to open the womb—every firstborn of the Israelis,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: since every firstborn of Israel belongs to me, from human beings to livestock. On the same day that I destroyed all the firstborn in the land of Egypt, I consecrated them to myself,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: taking the descendants of Levi instead of every firstborn of the Israelis.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I’ve set the descendants of Levi apart from the Israelis so that Aaron and his sons would work in service at the appointed place of meeting, making atonement on behalf of the Israelis so that there won’t be a plague among the Israelis whenever they approach the sanctuary.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses and Aaron and the Israelis did this on behalf of the descendants of Levi. The Israelis did everything that the Lord commanded concerning the descendants of Levi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The descendants of Levi therefore purified themselves, washed their clothes, and then Aaron presented them as wave offerings to the Lord. Aaron provided atonement for them to purify them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this, the descendants of Levi entered into their work of service at the appointed place, in the presence of Aaron and his sons. They did everything that the Lord commanded Moses concerning the descendants of Levi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Later, the Lord told Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now regarding a descendant of Levi who is 25 years and above, he is to enter work in the service at the appointed place of meeting,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but starting at 50 years of age, he is to retire from service and is no longer to work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He may minister to his brothers at the Tent of Meeting by keeping watch, but he is not to engage in service. This is how you are to act with respect to the obligations of the descendants of Levi.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord spoke to Moses in the Wilderness of Sinai during the first month of the second year that they had left Egypt,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The Israelis are to observe the Passover at its appointed time
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: on the fourteenth day of this month. You are to observe it at this appointed time between the evenings. You are to observe it according to all its decrees and laws.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses instructed the Israelis to observe the Passover.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They observed the Passover on the fourteenth day of the first month at twilight, in the Wilderness of Sinai. The Israelis did everything that the Lord had commanded through Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But there were men who couldn’t observe the Passover that day because they had come in contact with a corpse. That very day, they approached Moses and Aaron
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and asked, “Why can’t we bring an offering to the Lord at the appointed time among the Israelis, even though we are unclean because we came in contact with a corpse?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Wait while I hear what the Lord has to say about you,” Moses replied.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord told Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Instruct the Israelis that when any of you or your descendants becomes unclean due to contact with a corpse, or if he is on a long journey, he nevertheless is to observe the Lord’s Passover.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the fourteenth day of the second month at twilight, they are to eat it with unleavened bread and bitter herbs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are not to leave any of it to remain until morning nor are they to break any of its bones. They are to observe it according to all the statutes of the Passover.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now as to the person who is clean and isn’t traveling, but fails to observe the Passover, that person is to be eliminated from his people, because he didn’t bring an offering to the Lord at its appointed time. That person is to bear his sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a resident alien lives with you and wants to observe the Lord’s Passover, let him observe it according to the statutes and laws of the Passover. You are to maintain the same statute for the resident alien as you do for the native of the land.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the same morning that the tent was set up, a cloud covered the tent, that is, the Tent of Testimony, and in the evening fire appeared over the tent until morning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was so continuously—there was a cloud covering by day, and a fire cloud appeared at night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whenever the cloud above the tent ascended, the Israelis would travel and encamp in the place where the cloud settled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: According to whatever the Lord said, the Israelis would travel. According to whatever the Lord said, they would camp as long as the cloud remained over the Tent of Meeting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the cloud over the tent remained for a longer time, the Israelis did what the Lord had instructed and didn’t travel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were times when the cloud remained over the tent for a number of days. They camped in accordance with the Lord’s instructions and they traveled in accordance with the Lord’s instructions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were times when the cloud remained from evening until morning, but when the cloud ascended in the morning, they would journey. Whether by day or by night, they would travel whenever the cloud ascended.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whether for two days, a month, or for longer periods, whenever the cloud would remain above the tent, the Israelis would remain in camp, not traveling. But whenever it ascended, then they would travel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: According to what the Lord said, they would remain in camp, and according to what the Lord said, they would travel. They kept the commands that the Lord had given through Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord also told Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Make two trumpets, crafting them from beaten silver, for use in calling the congregation together and for notifying the camps to set out for travel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sound them when the whole assembly is to gather together at the entrance to the appointed place of meeting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When one trumpet is blown, the elders and the heads of the thousands of the Israelis are to gather to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you sound an alarm, the ones encamped on the east side are to begin to travel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you sound the alarm the second time, those encamped on the south are to begin to travel. Alarms are to be sounded for their travels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when you blow the trumpet to assemble the whole congregation, don’t use the same sound as you do for sounding an alarm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The descendants of Aaron the priest are to blow the trumpets. Have them do this for you permanently throughout your generations to come.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When you wage war in your land against an enemy who is hostile to you, you are to sound an alarm with the trumpets. Then you will be remembered before the face of the Lord your God and you will be delivered from your enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At the beginning of the month, during your time of rejoicing at the appointed place, sound the trumpet over your burnt offering, then sacrifice your peace offering, since they are to be your memorial before the Lord your God. I am the Lord your God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the twentieth day of the second month in the second year, the cloud was lifted up from the Tent of Meeting,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so the Israelis set out from the Sinai Wilderness until the cloud settled in the Paran Wilderness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: doing what the Lord had said through Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The standard of the camp of Judah was the first to travel, accompanied by its army with Amminadab’s son Nahshon in charge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zuar’s son Nethanel was in charge of the camp of Issachar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Helon’s son Eliab was in charge of the camp of Zebulun.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The tent was taken down, and the descendants of Gershon and Merari carried the tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the standard of the camp of Reuben set out, accompanied by its army with Shedeur’s son Elizur in charge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zurishaddai’s son Shelumiel was in charge of the tribe of Simeon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Deuel’s son Eliasaph was in charge of the tribe of Gad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the descendants of Kohath, carrying the sanctuary, set out, since the tent was to be set up before they arrive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this, the standard of the camp of Ephraim set out, accompanied by its army with Ammihud’s son Elishama in charge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pedazzur’s son Gamaliel was in charge of the tribe of Manasseh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Gideoni’s son Abidan was in charge of the army of the tribe of Benjamin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the standard of the camp of Dan set out, functioning as the rear guard for all the encampments, accompanied by its army with Ammishaddai’s son Ahiezer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ochran’s son Pagiel was in charge of the tribe of Asher.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Enan’s son Ahira was in charge of the tribe of Naphtali.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This was the travel order for the Israelis, whenever their companies traveled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses told Reuel’s son Hobab, Moses’ relative by marriage from Midian, “We are traveling to the place about which the Lord said ‘I will give it to you.’ So come with us and we’ll be good to you, because the Lord has spoken good things about Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said, “I won’t go with you because I’m returning to my land and to my own family.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses responded, “Please don’t leave us now, since you know where we can camp in the wilderness. You could be our guide.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when you come with us, the good things that the Lord will grant us, we’ll give you as well.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they traveled from the mountain of the Lord, a three-day trip, with the Ark of the Covenant of the Lord traveling in front of them—a three day trip to explore a place for them to rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, the cloud of the Lord protected them during the day when they left their camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whenever the ark was ready to travel, Moses would say:
“Arise, Lord,
    to scatter your enemies,
so that whoever hates you
    will flee from your presence.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whenever the ark was being readied to rest, he would say:
“Return, Lord,
    to the countless thousands of Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eventually, the people began complaining about their distress, and the Lord heard them. When the Lord heard, his anger flared up and the Lord’s fire incinerated some of them within the outskirts of the camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the people cried out to Moses, he prayed to the Lord and the fire stopped.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He then named that place Taberah, because the Lord’s fire had incinerated some of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Meanwhile, certain riff-raff among the people had an insatiable appetite for food. As a result, they wept and turned back, and the Israelis cried out, “If only somebody would feed us some meat!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How we remember the fish that we used to eat in Egypt for free! And the cucumbers, melons, leeks, onions, and garlic!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now we can’t stand it anymore, because there’s nothing in front of us except this manna.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now manna was reminiscent of coriander seed, with an appearance similar to amber.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: People would go out to gather it, then they would grind it in mills or pound it in mortars, and then they would boil it in pots or make cakes out of it that tasted like butter cakes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the dew fell in the camp, the manna came with it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses heard the people weeping throughout their entire families. Everyone gathered at the entrance to their tents so that the Lord was very angry. Moses thought the situation was bad,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so he asked the Lord, “Why did you bring all this trouble to your servant? Why haven’t I found favor in your eyes? After all, you’re putting the burden of this entire people on me!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Did I conceive this people or give birth to them, so that you would tell me to carry them near my heart like a wet nurse carries a suckling baby to the land that you promised to their forefathers?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Where am I going to get meat to give this people? After all, they’re crying in front of me, ‘Give us meat to eat!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I cannot carry this whole nation! The burden is too heavy for me!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If this is how you treat me, please kill me right now, if I’ve found favor in your eyes, because I don’t want to keep staring at all of this misery!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord told Moses, “Gather together for me 70 men who are elders of Israel, men whom you know to be elders of the people and officers over them. Then bring them to the Tent of Meeting and let them stand there with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I’ll come down and speak with you. I’ll take some of the spirit that rests on you and apportion it among them, so that they may help you bear the burden of the people. That way, you won’t bear it by yourself.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But give this command to the people: ‘You are to consecrate yourselves, because tomorrow you’re going to eat meat, since you’ve complained where the Lord can hear it, “Who can give us meat to eat? After all, life was better with us in Egypt.” Therefore, the Lord is going to give you meat and you’ll eat—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: not only for a day, or for two days, or for five days, or for ten days, or for 20 days,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but for a whole month—until it comes out your nostrils and makes you vomit. This is because you’ve despised the Lord, who is among you, and you cried out in his presence by complaining, “Why did we ever leave Egypt?”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses responded, “I’m with 600,000 people on foot and you’re saying I am to give them enough meat to eat for a whole month?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What if we were to slaughter our entire inventory of flocks and herds for them? Would that be enough? What if we could gather all the fish in the sea in nets for them? Would that be enough, either?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord responded to Moses, “Is the Lord short on power? You’re now going to witness whether what I say will come to pass or not.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses went out and told the people what the Lord had said. He gathered 70 men from the elders of the people and stationed them around the tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord came down in a cloud, spoke to Moses, and made an apportionment from the spirit who rested on him to the 70 elders. When the spirit rested on them, they prophesied, but that was it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now two men had remained in camp. One was named Eldad and the other was named Medad. When the spirit rested on them, since they were among those who were listed but had not gone out to the tent, they stayed behind and prophesied in the camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A young man ran and reported to Moses, “Eldad and Medad are prophesying in the camp!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In response, Nun’s son Joshua, Moses’ attendant and one of his choice men, exclaimed, “My master Moses! Stop them!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Are you jealous on account of me?” Moses asked in reply. “I wish all of the Lord’s people were prophets and that the Lord would put his spirit upon them!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses—that is, he and the elders of Israel—returned to the camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Just then, a wind burst forth from the Lord, who brought quails from the sea and spread them all around the camp, about a day’s journey in each direction, completely encircling the camp about two cubits deep on top of the ground!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people stayed up all that day, all that night, and all through the next day, gathering quails. The one who gathered least gathered enough to fill ten omers, as they spread out all around the camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But even as they were chewing the meat and before they had swallowed it, the Lord became very angry with the people and struck them with a disastrous plague.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That’s why the place was named Kibroth-hattaavah, because they buried the people there who had an insatiable appetite for meat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Later, the people left Kibroth-hattaavah for Hazeroth and camped there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Miriam and Aaron rebelled against Moses on account of the Cushite woman that he had married.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They asked, “Has the Lord spoken only through Moses? Hasn’t he also spoken through us?”
But the Lord heard it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the man Moses was very humble—more than any person on earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All of a sudden, the Lord told Moses, Aaron, and Miriam, “The three of you are to come out to the Tent of Meeting.” So the three of them went out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord came down in a pillar of cloud, stood at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting, and summoned Aaron and Miriam. So both of them went forward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he told the two of them: “Pay attention to what I have to say! When there is a prophet among you, won’t I, the Lord, reveal myself to him in a vision? Won’t I speak with him in a dream?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But that’s not how it is with my servant Moses, since he has been entrusted with my entire household!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I speak to him audibly and in visions, not in mysteries. If he can gaze at the image of the Lord, why aren’t you afraid to speak against my servant Moses?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because the Lord was very angry with them, he left,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but when the cloud ascended from the tent, Miriam had become leprous, as white as snow! Aaron turned toward Miriam, and she had leprosy!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Aaron begged Moses, “I pray my lord, please don’t hold this sin against us, since we’ve acted foolishly and sinned in doing so.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Please don’t let her be like one of the living dead, who is born with a congenital skin disease.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses prayed to the Lord: “O Lord, please heal her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord told Moses, “If her father had merely spit in her face, wouldn’t she be humiliated? She is to be placed in isolation for seven days. After that, she may be brought in.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Miriam was isolated outside the camp for seven days and the people didn’t travel until Miriam was brought in.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After that, the people traveled from Hazeroth and encamped in the Wilderness of Paran.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Later, the Lord told Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Send men to explore the land of Canaan that I’m about to give to the Israelis. Send one man to represent each of his ancestor’s tribes, every one of them a distinguished leader among them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So that’s just what Moses did, sending them from the Wilderness of Paran according to the Lord’s instructions. All of the men were Israeli leaders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were their names: From Reuben’s tribe, Zaccur’s son Shammua;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Simeon’s tribe, Hori’s son Shaphat;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Judah’s tribe, Jephunneh’s son Caleb;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from Issachar’s tribe, Joseph’s son Igal;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Ephraim’s tribe, Nun’s son Hoshea;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Benjamin’s tribe, Raphu’s son Palti;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from Zebulun’s tribe, Sodi’s son Gaddiel;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from Joseph’s tribe of Manasseh, Susi’s son Gaddi;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Dan’s tribe, Gemalli’s son Ammiel;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from Asher’s tribe, Michael’s son Sethur;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from Naphtali’s tribe, Vophsi’s son Nahbi;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and from Gad’s tribe, Machi’s son Geuel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
These are the names of the men sent by Moses to explore the land.
Moses renamed Nun’s son Hoshea to Joshua.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he sent them out to explore the land of Canaan. He instructed them, “Go up from here through the Negev, then ascend to the hill country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See what the land is like. Observe whether the people who live there are strong or weak, or whether they’re few or numerous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look to see whether the land where they live is good or bad, and whether the cities in which they live are merely tents or if they’re fortified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Examine the farmland, whether it’s fertile or barren, and see if there are fruit-bearing trees in it or not. Be very courageous, and bring back some samples of the fruit of the land.”
As it was, that time of year was the season for the first fruits of the grape harvest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they went to explore the land from the Wilderness of Zin to Rehob, and as far as the outskirts of Hamath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They went through the Negev and reached Hebron, where Ahiman, Sheshai, and Talmai, the descendants of Anak lived. (Hebron had been constructed seven years before Zoan in Egypt had been built).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Soon they arrived in the valley of Eshcol, where they cut a single branch of grapes and carried it on a pole between two men, along with some pomegranates and figs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The entire place was called the Eshcol Valley on account of the cluster of grapes that the men of Israel had taken from there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At the end of 40 days, they all returned from exploring the land,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: came in to Moses and Aaron, and delivered their report to the entire congregation of Israel in the Wilderness of Paran at Kadesh. They brought back their report to the entire congregation and showed them the fruit of the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator
