verses.text: So this has been a list of those who were registered by Moses and Eleazar the priest when they numbered the Israelis in the plains of Moab by the Jordan at Jericho.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But none of these men among these numbered by Moses and by Aaron the priest (that is, when they numbered the Israelis in the wilderness of Sinai) survived to enter the land,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because the Lord had said about them, “They’ll certainly die in the wilderness. No man will survive from them except Jephunneh’s son Caleb and Nun’s son Joshua.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the daughters of Hepher’s son Zelophehad, Gilead’s grandson, who had been fathered by Machir, who had been fathered by Manasseh, from the tribe of Manasseh, the direct son of Joseph, were named Mahlah, Noah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Tirzah. They approached
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses, Eleazar the priest, the elders, and the entire community at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting, stood before them, and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Our father died in the wilderness, but he wasn’t with the company of those who gathered against the Lord along with the company of Korah. He died in his own sin, and he had no sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why are you going to eliminate the name of our father from his family, just because he had no son? Give us a possession from among our father’s relatives.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses brought the family into the Lord’s presence,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the Lord told Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The daughters of Zelophehad are telling the truth. You are certainly to give to them a possession for an inheritance among their father’s relatives. You are to pass on the inheritance of their father to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Tell the Israelis that when a man dies without a son, you are to pass his inheritance to his daughter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If he doesn’t have a daughter, give his inheritance to his brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If he doesn’t have brothers, give his inheritance to his father’s brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If his father doesn’t have brothers, then give his inheritance to a relative who is nearest to him from the family and he’ll take possession of it. This is to be a permanent ordinance for the Israelis, just as the Lord commanded Moses.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord told Moses, “You are to climb these Abarim mountains and look over the land that I’m going to give the Israelis.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After you’ve seen it, you’ll be taken to be with your people just as your brother Aaron was gathered to them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because in the wilderness of Zin, when the community rebelled, you rebelled against my command to treat me as holy before their eyes in regards to the Meribah Springs in Kadesh in the wilderness of Zin.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses responded to the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “May the Lord God of the spirits of all living creatures appoint a man over the community
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who will go in and out before them, and who will lead them out and bring them in so that the Lord’s community won’t be like a flock without a shepherd.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Select Nun’s son Joshua. The Spirit is in that man,” the Lord answered Moses. “You are to lay your hand on him
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and make him stand in front of Eleazar the priest and the entire community. Then you are to set him in charge right before their eyes,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: turning over your authority to him so that the entire community of Israel knows to obey him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to make him stand in the presence of Eleazar the priest, who is to inquire on his behalf using the Urim in the presence of the Lord regarding a decision of judgment, because by his command he and all the Israelis with him will go out or come in.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses did what the Lord had commanded him. He took Joshua, made him stand in the presence of Eleazar the priest and the entire community,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: laid his hands on him, and charged him, just as the Lord had commanded, using Moses’ authority.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord told Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are to command the Israelis about my offerings that they are to be sure to bring edible offerings to me, presented by fire, and a pleasing aroma to me, at their appointed time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Tell them that this is the offering, presented by fire, that you are to offer to the Lord: two one year old lambs, offered daily every day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Offer the first lamb in the morning and the second toward the evening,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: accompanied by one tenth of an ephah of fine flour for grain offering, mixed with one fourth of a hin of pure olive oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This burnt offering, which was prescribed at Mount Sinai, is to be offered every day as a pleasing aroma made by fire to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The drink offering is to be one fourth of a hin for each lamb. You are to pour out a drink offering of strong wine to the Lord in the Holy Place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are also to offer the second lamb toward the evening. Just like the morning sacrifice, you are to present the grain offering, accompanied by its corresponding drink offering, as a presentation made by fire, a pleasing aroma to the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Every Sabbath day, you are to offer two one year old lambs without any defects with two tenths of an ephah of fine flour for grain offering, mixed with olive oil, along with their corresponding drink offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This burnt offering is to be presented every Sabbath, as well as the regular burnt offering, along with its corresponding drink offering.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “On the first day of each month, you are to offer a burnt offering to the Lord consisting of two young bulls, one ram, and seven one year old lambs, all of them without any defects,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: along with three tenths of an ephah of fine flour for a grain offering, mixed with olive oil, for each bull, two tenths of an ephah of fine flour for a grain offering, mixed with olive oil, for the one ram,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and one tenth of an ephah of fine flour mixed with olive oil as a grain offering for each lamb. This burnt offering will be a pleasing aroma, incinerated as an offering to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their drink offerings are to be half a hin of wine for each bull, one third of a hin for the ram, and one fourth of a hin for each lamb. This burnt offering is to be presented each and every month throughout the year.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One goat is to be offered at regular intervals as a sin offering to the Lord, accompanied by its corresponding drink offering.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The Lord’s Passover is to take place on the fourteenth day of the first month.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to hold a festival on the fifteenth day of this month for seven days, during which time unleavened bread is to be eaten.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “On the first day, you are to hold a sacred assembly. No servile work is to be done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bring an offering that is to be incinerated in the Lord’s presence, consisting of two young bulls, a ram, and seven one year old lambs, all without any defects,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: along with their grain offering of fine flour mixed with olive oil. Offer three tenths of an ephah for each bull, two tenths of an ephah for the ram,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and one tenth of an ephah for each of the seven lambs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then present one goat for a sin offering to make atonement for you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: apart from the burnt offering in the morning, which you are to continue offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do this every day for seven days, as an edible sacrifice to the Lord made by fire, a pleasing aroma. It is to be offered apart from the regular burnt offering and its corresponding drink offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the seventh day you are to hold another sacred assembly for your benefit, on which no servile work is to be done.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “On the first day of your harvest season, you are to hold a sacred assembly when you present your first fruits during the Festival of Weeks. No servile work is to be done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to offer this burnt offering as a pleasing aroma to the Lord: two young bulls, one ram, and seven one year old lambs,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: along with their corresponding grain offerings of fine flour mixed with olive oil; specifically, three tenths of an ephah for each bull, two tenths of an ephah for the one ram,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one tenth of an ephah for each of the seven lambs,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and one goat to make atonement for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Offer them in addition to the regular burnt offering, accompanied by its grain offering and its corresponding drink offerings.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are to hold a sacred assembly on the first day of the seventh month of each year. No servile work is to be done. It’s a day of blowing trumpets for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are to bring these burnt offerings as a pleasing aroma to the Lord: a one year old young bull, one ram, and seven one year old lambs, all without any defects,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: along with their corresponding grain offering of fine flour mixed with olive oil—three tenths of an ephah for the young bull, two tenths of an ephah for the ram,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and one tenth of an ephah for each lamb of the seven lambs,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: accompanied by one goat for a sin offering to make atonement for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is to be separate and apart from the burnt offering for the New Moon, with its corresponding grain offering, the regular burnt offering with its corresponding grain offering, and their drink offerings, according to their respective ordinances, as a pleasing aroma, an incinerated offering made to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are to hold a sacred assembly on the tenth day of this same seventh month. You are to humble yourselves, and no servile work is to be done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to bring these burnt offerings to the Lord for a pleasing aroma: one young bull, one ram, and seven one year old lambs, all without any defects, for you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: along with these corresponding grain offerings of fine flour mixed with olive oil: three tenths for the bull, two tenths for the one ram,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and one tenth for each of the seven lambs,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then one male goat for a sin offering, in addition to the sin offering, to make atonement, along with the regular burnt offering and its corresponding grain and drink offerings.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are to hold a sacred assembly on the fifteenth day of the same seventh month. No servile work is to be done. You are to celebrate a festival to the Lord for seven days by
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: bringing these burnt offerings made by fire as a pleasing aroma to the Lord: Thirteen young bulls, two rams, and fourteen one year old lambs, all without any defects,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: along with their grain offering of fine flour mixed with olive oil—three tenths for each of the thirteen bulls, two tenths for each of the two rams,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and one tenth for each of the fourteen lambs,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: accompanied by one goat for a sin offering, in addition to the regular burnt offering, with its corresponding grain and drink offerings.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “On the second day, you are to present twelve young bulls, two rams, and fourteen one year old lambs, all without defects,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: along with corresponding grain and drink offerings for the bulls, rams, and lambs, according to their number, based on the ordinances,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and accompanied by one goat for a sin offering, in addition to the regular burnt offering, with its corresponding grain and drink offerings.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “On the third day, you are to present eleven bulls, two rams, and fourteen one year old lambs, all without defects,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: along with corresponding grain and drink offerings for the bulls, rams, and lambs, according to their number, based on the ordinances,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and accompanied by one goat for a sin offering, in addition to the regular burnt offering, with its corresponding grain and drink offerings.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “On the fourth day, you are to present ten bulls, two rams, and fourteen one year old lambs, all without defects,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: along with corresponding grain and drink offerings for the bulls, rams, and lambs, according to their number, based on the ordinances,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and accompanied by one goat for a sin offering, in addition to the regular burnt offering, with its corresponding grain and drink offerings.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “On the fifth day, you are to present nine bulls, two rams, and fourteen one year old lambs, all without defects,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: along with corresponding grain and drink offerings for the bulls, rams, and lambs, according to their number, based on the ordinances,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and accompanied by one goat for a sin offering, in addition to the regular burnt offering, with its corresponding grain and drink offerings.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “On the sixth day, you are to present eight bulls, two rams, and fourteen one year old lambs, all without defects,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: along with corresponding grain and drink offerings for the bulls, rams, and lambs, according to their number, based on the ordinances,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and accompanied by one goat for a sin offering, in addition to the regular burnt offering, with its corresponding grain and drink offerings.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “On the seventh day, you are to present seven bulls, two rams, and fourteen one year old lambs, all without defects,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: along with corresponding grain and drink offerings for the bulls, rams, and lambs, according to their number, based on the ordinances,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and accompanied by one goat for a sin offering, in addition to the regular burnt offering, with corresponding grain and drink offerings.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “On the eighth day, you are to call a sacred assembly. No servile work is to be done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to offer these burnt offerings by fire, a pleasing aroma to the Lord: one bull, one ram, and seven one year old lambs, all without defects,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: along with corresponding grain and drink offerings for the bull, ram, and lambs, according to their number, based on the ordinances,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and accompanied by one goat for a sin offering, in addition to the regular burnt offering, with corresponding grain and drink offerings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Present these to the Lord at your appointed festival, in addition to your offerings in fulfillment of vows, free will offerings, burnt offerings, grain offerings, drink offerings, and peace offerings.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses instructed the Israelis regarding everything that the Lord had commanded him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Later, Moses told the elders of the Israeli tribes, “This is what the Lord has commanded:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘When a man makes a vow to the Lord, or swears an oath—an obligation that is binding to himself—he is not to break his word. Instead, he is to fulfill whatever promise came out of his mouth.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When a young woman makes a vow to the Lord or pledges herself to an obligation while she still lives in her father’s house,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and her father hears her vow and the obligations that she had pledged herself to fulfill, yet her father keeps silent about it, then all her vows and every obligation she pledged herself to are to stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if her father disallows her on the same day that he hears what she has said, then all her vows and every obligation she had pledged herself to fulfill are not to stand. The Lord will forgive her, because her father has forbidden her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If she has a husband and she makes a vow that is binding on herself, or if she makes a hasty vow with her mouth that she pledges herself to fulfill,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and her husband hears her vow, yet remains silent on the day that he hears it, then her vows are to stand and the obligation to which she had pledged herself is to stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if, on the same day her husband hears and disallows her, then he has revoked her vows that she made for herself, along with any hasty vows that she spoke and to which she pledged herself to fulfill. The Lord will forgive her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Everything that a widow or a divorced woman pledges herself to fulfill are to be binding on her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If, while she had been living in her late or former husband’s house, she makes a vow or a promise that binds her with an oath,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and her husband hears it but remains silent, not disallowing it, then all her vows are to stand, along with every obligation that she has pledged to fulfill.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if her husband disallowed them the very day that he heard her, everything that she spoke relating to her vows and her obligation to herself are not to stand, because her husband revoked them. The Lord will forgive her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Her husband may confirm or revoke every vow and binding obligation that afflicts her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if her husband remains silent about her from day to day, then he has affirmed all her vows or obligations that she has obligated herself to fulfill. He has affirmed them because he remained silent from the day he heard her vows.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if he nullified them after he had heard, then he will be responsible for any resulting iniquity.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the statutes that the Lord commanded Moses concerning a man and his wife and concerning a father and his young daughter while she still lives in her father’s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Later, the Lord told Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Be sure to exact vengeance on behalf of the Israelis from the Midianites, after which you’ll be taken home to your people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses instructed the people, “Muster your men of war to attack the Midianites and deliver the Lord’s vengeance against Midian.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Send 1,000 men to war from every tribe throughout all of Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So 1,000 men from every tribe—12,000 from the thousands of Israel—were mustered and equipped for war.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses sent 1,000 men from every tribe to fight against them, along with Eleazar’s son Phinehas, in whose hands were the articles of the sanctuary and trumpets to sound battle alarms.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They fought against the Midianites just as the Lord had commanded Moses, killing every man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They executed the five kings of Midian, including Evi, Rekem, Zur, Hur, and Reba. They also executed Beor’s son Balaam with a sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this, the Israelis took captive the Midianite women and children and confiscated as spoils of war all their cattle, livestock, and their goods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They burned every town where they had lived and incinerated all of their encampments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They took all the booty and plunder, including both humans and animals.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they brought the captives, booty, and plunder to Moses, to Eleazar the priest, and to the entire community of Israel at the camp on the plains of Moab, by the Jordan River in Jericho.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses and Eleazar the priest and all the leaders of the community went out to meet them outside the camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Moses became livid with anger at the officers of the army, the captains of thousands, and the captains of hundreds who had returned from servicing in the battle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Did you keep all the women alive?” Moses asked them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Look! These women were the same ones who were counseled by Balaam to cause the Israelis to commit a grievous sin against the Lord at Peor. As a result, that plague infected the Lord’s community.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to kill every male child and every woman who has had sexual relations with a man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to allow the young women who haven’t yet had sexual relations with a man to live for yourselves.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now you are to stay outside the camp for seven days, after which any of you who has killed a person or touched someone who was killed may purify yourselves on the third day. You and your captives will be pure on the seventh day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Furthermore, you are to purify every garment—that is, everything made of leather, goat’s hair, or containing wood.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eleazar the priest told the soldiers who had gone to battle, “This is the ordinance of the law that the Lord commanded Moses
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: concerning anything containing gold, silver, brass, iron, tin, lead,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: or anything else that can survive a refiner’s fire: You are to pass it through fire, after which it will be clean. Then it is to be purified with the water of impurity. Everything that cannot survive a refiner’s fire is to be washed in water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wash your clothes on the seventh day, after which you will be clean. Then you may enter the camp.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord told Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Take an inventory of the booty that was taken in the battle, both of humans and of animals. Then you, Eleazar the priest, and the leaders of the fathers of the community
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: are to divide the booty between the warriors who went to war and the rest of the community.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “After this, you are to exact a tribute for the Lord from the soldiers who went to war, consisting of the tribute earned by one person out of every 500, whether from people, cattle, donkeys, or flocks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to take half their share and give it to Eleazar the priest as a raised offering to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then take half the share of the Israelis, one drawn out of every 50 people, cattle, donkeys, flocks, and from every animal, then give to the descendants of Levi who maintain the service of the Lord’s tent.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses and Eleazar the priest did what the Lord had commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The goods confiscated in excess of the war implements that the warriors had gathered included 675,000 sheep,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: 72,000 cattle,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: 61,000 donkeys, and
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: 32,000 women who had not had sexual relations with a man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now half of the share of those who went to war numbered 337,500 sheep,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so the Lord’s tribute from the sheep totaled 675.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The cattle numbered 36,000, so the Lord’s tribute totaled 72.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The donkeys numbered 30,500, so the Lord’s tribute totaled 61.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people numbered 16,000, so the Lord’s tribute totaled 32 people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses gave the tribute, a raised offering to the Lord, to Eleazar the priest, just as the Lord had commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From half of the share of the Israelis that Moses had set aside from the soldiers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: there were 337,500 sheep for the community,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: 36,000 cattle,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: 30,500 donkeys,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and 16,000 people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses took a portion drawn from every 50 Israelis, including from both human and animals, and gave them to the descendants of Levi who maintained the Lord’s tent, just as the Lord had commanded him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the officers in charge of thousands of soldiers, the captains of thousands, and the captains of hundreds approached Moses
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and told him, “Your servants took a count of the soldiers who were under our authority. We didn’t miss a single man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We’ve brought offerings to the Lord from whatever each man found—jewel-encrusted gold, anklets, bracelets, signet rings, earrings, and necklaces—to make atonement for ourselves in the Lord’s presence.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses and Eleazar the priest took the gold from them and everything that was fashioned into jewels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The gold for the raised offering that they brought to the Lord totaled 16,750 shekels,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because every soldier had confiscated war booty for his own use.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses and Eleazar took the gold from the captains of thousands and hundreds and brought it to the Tent of Meeting, to serve as a memorial to the Israelis in the Lord’s presence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, the descendants of Reuben and descendants of Gad happened to be joint owners of a very large herd of cattle. When they observed that Jazer and Gilead were good grazing lands for cattle,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the descendants of Gad and descendants of Reuben approached Moses, Eleazar the priest, and the leaders of the community and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Ataroth, Dibon, Jazer, Nimrah, Heshbon, Elealeh, Sebam, Nebo, and Beon—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the land that the Lord defeated in the sight of the community of Israel—is perfect for cattle and your servants have cattle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If we’ve found favor in your sight, let this land be given to your servants as our possession instead of us crossing the Jordan River.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Will your relatives have to go to war while you remain here?” Moses asked the descendants of Gad and descendants of Reuben in response.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Why would you discourage the Israelis from crossing over to the land that the Lord has given them?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That’s what your ancestors did when I sent them from Kadesh-barnea to explore the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they arrived in the Eshcol Valley and saw the land, they discouraged the Israelis from entering the land that the Lord had given them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That’s why the Lord’s anger flared up that day and he promised by an oath that
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Not one of the men who went up from Egypt, from 20 years old and above, will see the land that I promised to give to their ancestors, that is, to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, because none of them followed me wholeheartedly,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: except Jephunneh’s son Caleb, the Kenizzite, and Nun’s son Joshua. They’ve wholeheartedly followed the Lord.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The Lord’s anger had flared up against Israel so that he made them wander in the wilderness for 40 years until that whole generation, who committed evil in the eyes of the Lord, had died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And now, look! You’re acting just like your ancestors, like a brood of sinful men, who are provoking the fierce anger of the Lord against the Israelis one step at a time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you stop following him, he will once again abandon them in the wilderness. You’ll end up destroying this entire people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they approached him and said, “Here’s where we’re going to build corrals for our cattle and cities for our families,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but we will keep ourselves armed and stay ready to go with the Israelis until we’ve brought them to their own places. Our families intend to live in fortified cities in the presence of the inhabitants of the land,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but we won’t return to our homes until every Israeli has taken possession of each of their inheritances,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: since our inheritance will not be with them across the Jordan River and beyond. Instead, our inheritance is on this side of the Jordan River, facing eastward.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If you do this,” Moses replied to them, “that is, if you equip yourselves for war in the Lord’s presence
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and every one of your armed soldiers crosses over the Jordan River in the presence of the Lord until he has dispossessed his enemies ahead of him
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and subjugated the land before him, then afterwards when you return, you’ll be able to stand blameless before the Lord and before Israel. This land will then be your possession before the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But if you won’t do so, look out! You will be sinning against the Lord. Be certain of this, that your sin will catch up to you!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So after you’ve built cities for your families and corrals for your cattle, be sure to keep your promises.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the descendants of Gad and descendants of Reuben spoke up. “Your servants will do exactly what our master has commanded.” They said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Our children, wives, flocks, and all our cattle will be settled in the cities of Gilead,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but every soldier that we’ve equipped for battle will cross the Jordan River in the presence of the Lord, as our master has spoken.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses instructed Eleazar the priest and Nun’s son Joshua, and the officers of the ancestral tribes of the Israelis,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: telling them, “If the descendants of Gad and descendants of Reuben cross over the Jordan River with you, that is, all of their soldiers who’ve been equipped for battle in the Lord’s presence, so that the land is subjugated right before your eyes, then you are to give them the land of Gilead as their possession.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if the armed men don’t cross over with you, then they won’t have any possession in the land of Canaan.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “We’ll do just what the Lord told your servants,” the descendants of Gad and the descendants of Reuben responded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “We are to cross over in battle array in the Lord’s presence into the land of Canaan, and afterwards the possession of our inheritance will be on this side of the Jordan River.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses gave to the descendants of Gad, to the descendants of Reuben, and to the half-tribe of Joseph’s son Manasseh the kingdom of Sihon, the king of the Amorites, and the kingdom of Og, the king of Bashan, the whole land with its cities, and even the territories surrounding it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The descendants of Gad rebuilt Dibon, Ataroth, Aroer,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Atrothshophan, Jazer, Jogbehah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Beth-nimrah, and Beth-haran as fortified cities with corrals for sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The descendants of Reuben rebuilt Heshbon, Elealeh, Kiriathaim,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nebo, Baal-meon (after having changed their names), and Sibmah. The cities that they rebuilt were renamed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The descendants of Manasseh’s son Machir attacked Gilead and then captured and dispossessed the Amorites who were there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That’s why Moses gave Gilead to Manasseh’s son Machir, who lived there at the time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Manasseh’s son Jair captured their towns and renamed them Havvoth-jair.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nobah captured Kenath and its towns and renamed it Nobah after himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Here’s the travel itinerary for the Israelis after they left the land of Egypt in groups under the authority of Moses and Aaron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses recorded their departures in their travels after being commanded to do so by the Lord. Here’s a list of their travels based on their departures:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They departed from Rameses in the first month, on the fifteenth day of that first month. The day after the Passover, the Israelis came out confidently, and all the Egyptians watched them leave,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: while they were burying their firstborn, whom the Lord had killed among them. The Lord also executed justice against their gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Israelis traveled from Rameses and rested in Succoth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from Succoth, then rested in Etham, which is at the outskirts of the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They traveled from Etham but turned back to Pi-hahiroth, which is outside of Baal-zephon.
They rested outside of Migdol.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from Hahiroth and passed through the midst of the sea to the wilderness. They were on the road three days in the wilderness of Etham, then rested in Marah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from Marah and arrived at Elim. In Elim there were twelve wells of water and 70 palm trees, so they rested there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from Elim, then rested by the Reed Sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from the Reed Sea, then rested in the Wilderness of Zin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from the Wilderness of Zin, then rested in Dophkah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from Dophkah, then rested in Alush.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from Alush, then rested in Rephidim, but there was no water there for the people to drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from Rephidim, then rested in the Wilderness of Sinai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from the Wilderness of Sinai, then rested in Kibroth-hattaavah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from Kibroth-hattaavah, then rested in Hazeroth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from Hazeroth, then rested in Rithmah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from Rithmah, then rested in Rimmon-perez.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from Rimmon-perez, then rested in Libnah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from Libnah, then rested in Rissah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from Rissah, then rested in Kehelathah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from Kehelathah, then rested at Mount Shepher.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from Mount Shepher, then rested in Haradah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from Haradah, then rested in Makheloth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from Makheloth, then rested in Tahath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from Tahath, then rested in Terah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from Terah, then rested in Mithkah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from Mithkah, then rested in Hashmonah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from Hashmonah, then rested in Moseroth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from Moseroth, then rested in Bene-jaakan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from Bene-jaakan, then rested in Hor-haggidgad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from Hor-haggidgad, then rested in Jotbathah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from Jotbathah, then rested in Abronah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from Abronah, then rested in Ezion-geber.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from Ezion-geber, then rested in the Wilderness of Zin, which is also known as Kadesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from Kadesh, then rested in Mount Hor at the outskirts of the land of Edom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Aaron the priest ascended Mount Hor in obedience to the Lord’s command and died there, in the fortieth year after the Israelis had come out of the land of Egypt, on the first day of the fifth month.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Aaron was 123 years old when he died on Mount Hor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Meanwhile, the Canaanite king of Arad, who lived in the Negev in the land of Canaan, heard of the approach of the Israelis,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who had traveled from Mount Hor and then rested in Zalmonah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from Zalmonah, then rested in Punon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from Punon, then rested in Oboth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from Oboth, then rested in Iye-abarim at the outskirts of Moab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from Iyim, then rested in Dibon-gad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from Dibon-gad, then rested in Almon-diblathaim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from Almon-diblathaim, then rested in the mountains of Abarim, facing Nebo.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from the mountains of Abarim, then rested in the plains of Moab by the Jordan River, across from Jericho.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They rested by the Jordan River in the area from Beth-jeshimoth to Abel-shittim in the plains of Moab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord told Moses in the plains of Moab by the Jordan River, across from Jericho,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Tell the Israelis that when they have crossed the Jordan River to the land of Canaan,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they are to drive out all the inhabitants of the land and destroy all their idols and their molten images. You are to demolish all their high places,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: take possession of the land, and live in it, because I’ve given you the land to inherit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to divide the land among yourselves by lot according to your families. The larger the families are in number, the larger their inheritance is to be. The fewer the families are in number, the lesser their inheritance is to be. To whomever the lot falls, that inheritance goes to him. Divide it according to your ancestral tribes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you fail to drive out the inhabitants of the land before you, their survivors will become irritants in your eyes and thorns in your sides, to prick your sides and afflict you in the very land in which you’ll be living.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then, what I had planned to do to them, I’ll start to do to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord told Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Issue these orders to the Israelis: ‘You’re about to enter the land of Canaan. This territory has been apportioned to you as your inheritance: the entire land of Canaan, all the way to its borders.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘To your south is the Wilderness of Zin, bordering Edom. Your southern border is to extend east toward the far end of the Dead Sea,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then it is to turn southward to the ascent of Akrabbim, cross Zin, and then run south of Kadesh-barnea and proceed from there to Hazar-addar and across to Azmon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the border is to turn from Azmon toward the wadi of Egypt and from there to the Mediterranean Sea.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘The western border is to be the Mediterranean Sea. This is to be the western border.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘Your northern border is to extend from the Mediterranean Sea to Mount Hor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Mount Hor, you are to mark out the entrance to Hammath, with the border running through Zedad,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then through Ziphron, and then to Hazar-enan. This is to be the northern border.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘You are to mark the border on the east from Hazar-enan to Shepham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The border is then to extend from Shepham to Riblah, on the east side of Ain, then to the Sea of Chinnereth on the east.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The border is to continue along the Jordan River all the way to the Dead Sea. This is to be your land, as measured by its boundaries.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses commanded the Israelis, “You are to inherit this land by lot, just as the Lord commanded to give it to the remaining nine and a half tribes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The tribes of Reuben, Gad, and half the tribe of Manasseh, as defined by their ancestral houses, have received their inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These two and a half tribes received their inheritance this side of the Jordan River, east of Jericho, facing the rising sun.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord told Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “These are the names of the men who are to divide the land for your inheritance: Eleazar the priest and Nun’s son Joshua.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to appoint a leader from each tribe to divide the land for inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the names of the men: Appoint Jephunneh’s son Caleb from the tribe of Judah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ammihud’s son Shemuel from the tribe of Simeon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Chislon’s son Elidad from the tribe of Benjamin,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Jogli’s son Bukki is to be leader of the tribe of Dan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the tribe of Joseph, you are to appoint Ephod’s son Hanniel to be leader of the half tribe of Manasseh,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shiphtan’s son Kemuel to be leader of the half tribe of Ephraim,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Parnach’s son Elizaphan to be leader of the tribe of Zebulun,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Azzan’s son Paltiel to be leader of the tribe of Issachar,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shelomi’s son Ahihud to be leader of the tribe of Asher,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Ammihud’s son Pedahel to be leader of the tribe of Naphtali.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the ones whom the Lord commanded to divide the inheritance of the Israelis in the land of Canaan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord told Moses in the wilderness of Moab, beside the Jordan River near Jericho,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Instruct the Israelis to set aside a portion of their inheritance for the descendants of Levi to live in, along with grazing land surrounding their towns.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The towns are to be reserved for their dwelling places and the grazing lands are to be reserved for their cattle, livestock, and all their animals.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The grazing lands that you are to reserve for use by the descendants of Levi are to extend 1,000 cubits from the walls of the town.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to measure from outside the wall of the town on the east side 2,000 cubits, on the south side 2,000 cubits, on the west side 2,000 cubits, and on the north side 2,000 cubits, with the town placed at the center. This reserved area is to serve as grazing land for their towns.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to set aside six towns of refuge from the towns that you will be giving to the descendants of Levi, where someone who kills a human being may run for shelter. In addition, give them 42 other towns.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The total number of towns that you are to give to the descendants of Levi is to be 48 towns, including grazing lands surrounding these towns.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to apportion the towns that you will be giving the Israelis according to the relative size of the tribe. Take a larger portion from those larger in number and a lesser portion from those fewer in number. Each is to set aside towns for the descendants of Levi proportional to the size of their inheritance that they receive.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord told Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Tell the Israelis that when they have crossed the Jordan River into the land of Canaan,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they are to designate some towns of refuge so that anyone who kills someone inadvertently may flee there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are to serve as cities of refuge from a blood avenger in order to keep the inadvertent killer from dying until he has stood trial in the presence of the community.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to set aside six towns of refuge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Appoint three towns this side of the Jordan River and three towns in the land of Canaan to serve as the towns of refuge,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that is, places of refuge for the Israelis, the resident alien, and any travelers among them. Anyone who kills a person inadvertently may flee there.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Whoever uses an iron implement to kill someone is to be adjudged a murderer, and that murderer is certainly to be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Furthermore, whoever uses a stone implement to kill someone is to be adjudged a murderer, and that murderer is certainly to be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also, whoever uses a wooden implement to kill someone with it is to be adjudged a murderer, and that murderer is certainly to be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The blood avenger himself is to execute the murderer. When he meets him, the blood avenger is to put him to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the killer shoved his victim out of hatred, or hurled something at him while waiting in ambush so that he died,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: or if he struck him with his hand out of hatred so that he died, then the killer is certainly to be put to death for murder. The avenger of blood is to put him to death when he meets him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But if he pushed him suddenly without hatred, or if he hurled something in his direction without waiting in ambush,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: or if he hit him with a stone carelessly so that he was fatally injured, though he isn’t his enemy and he wasn’t seeking to commit evil against him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then the community is to judge between the inadvertent killer and the blood avenger, following these ordinances.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The community is to release the inadvertent killer from the blood avenger and return him to the town of refuge where he had fled. He is to live there until the High Priest dies, who will have anointed him with holy oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if the inadvertent killer leaves the town of refuge where he had fled
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the blood avenger finds him outside the town of refuge where he had fled and kills him, the blood avenger is not to be found guilty of murder.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The inadvertent killer is to live in the town of refuge until the High Priest dies. After the death of the High Priest, the inadvertent killer is to return to the land of his inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are to be the statutes and ordinances for you throughout all your generations, regardless of where you live.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Every murderer of a human being is to be executed only according to testimony given by multiple witnesses. A single witness is not to result in a death sentence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to receive no ransom for the life of a killer who is guilty of murder; instead, he is to die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are not to receive payment of a ransom for someone who had fled to a town of refuge but then left to live in his homeland before the death of the high priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are not to pollute the land where you live, because blood defiles the land, and the land cannot atone for blood that has been spilled on it, except through the blood of the one who spilled it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are not to defile the land where you will be living, because I’m living among you. I am the Lord, who lives in Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The leaders of the ancestral families of the descendants of Gilead, who were descendants of Machir, and descendants of Manasseh, from Joseph’s tribe, approached and spoke to Moses and the leaders of the ancestral houses of the Israelis.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The Lord commanded my master to apportion the land as an inheritance by lot to the Israelis,” they said. “Now my master was ordered by the Lord to give the inheritance of our brother Zelophehad to his daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when they get married to one of the descendants of the tribes of Israel, their inheritances are to be withdrawn from our father’s inheritance and added to the inheritance of the tribe to which they are to belong. Consequently, it is to be withdrawn from the portion of our inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then, when the Jubilee Year of the Israelis comes, their inheritance will be added to the inheritance of the tribe to which they have come to belong. Their inheritance will thus be taken away from the inheritance of our father’s tribe!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses issued the Israelis these orders based on what the Lord said: “The tribe of the descendants of Joseph has spoken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what the Lord is commanding the daughters of Zelophehad: If they decide it’s a good idea in their opinion to get married only within the family of their father’s tribe, then let them get married
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that the inheritance of the Israelis won’t be turned over from one tribe to another. Each one has an inheritance from his own father’s tribe that the Israelis are to maintain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every daughter who is in possession of an inheritance from the Israelis is to marry someone from the families within her father’s tribe so the Israelis can retain possession of their ancestral inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That way, their inheritance won’t be turned over from one tribe to another, because the Israelis are each to maintain their ancestral inheritances.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zelophehad’s daughters did just what the Lord had commanded Moses
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for Mahlah, Tirzah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Noah: Zelophehad’s daughters married their uncle’s sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They married into families of the descendants of Manasseh, that is, Joseph’s descendants, so that their inheritance remained within the tribe of their ancestor’s family.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were the commands and the ordinances that the Lord issued to the Israelis through Moses in the plains of Moab by the Jordan River in Jericho.
verses.speaker: Narrator
